name: Milk Thistle
climate: Milk thistle thrives in Mediterranean climates with warm, dry summers.
This plant prefers temperate zones and can tolerate mild winters.
It can adapt to various climates but prefers areas with minimal frost.
In colder regions, milk thistle may struggle to survive harsh winters.
sunlight: Milk thistle requires full sunlight for optimal growth and flowering.
It thrives in open, sunny areas where it can receive direct light.
Partial shade can be tolerated, but full sun is preferred for best results.
Ensure milk thistle is not planted in heavily shaded or dark areas.
watering: Milk thistle has low water needs and tolerates dry soil conditions well.
Water sparingly as the plant is drought-resistant once established.
Overwatering can lead to root rot, so ensure good drainage.
During dry spells, occasional watering is beneficial but not essential.
soil: Milk thistle grows best in well-drained soil with a neutral pH level.
It thrives in sandy or loamy soils that provide good aeration.
Poorly draining clay soils can hinder growth and should be avoided.
Adding organic matter can improve soil quality and support growth.
toxic: Milk thistle is not known to be toxic to humans or pets.
However, the sharp spines can cause physical injury if handled carelessly.
extra_care_tip: Deadhead the flowers to prevent self-seeding and spreading.
Wear gloves when handling to avoid being pricked by the spines.
